alert.note: Alert for Collingsworth (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued October 04 at 2:31PM CDT until October 04 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN COLLINGSWORTH COUNTY... At 230 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 11 miles south of Texola, or 17 miles southeast of Shamrock, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Collingsworth County. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
